title: Gas Chromatography Data Schema
description: Gas chromatography (GC) is the process of separating compounds in a mixture by injecting a gaseous or liquid sample into a mobile phase, typically called the carrier gas, and passing the gas through a stationary phase. The mobile phase is usually an inert gas or unreactive gas such as helium, argon, nitrogen or hydrogen. The stationary phase is contained inside of a separation column. Today, most GC columns are fused silica capillaries with an inner diameter of 100-320 Î¼m and a length of 5-60 m. The GC column is located inside an oven where the temperature of the gas can be controlled and the effluent coming off the column is monitored by a suitable detector as a function of retention time.

SampleID.title: Sample ID
SampleID.description: OSDU Identifier for the Sample associated with this analysis.

SampleMass.title: Sample Mass
SampleMass.description: Reported mass of the analyzed sample.

Method.title: Method
Method.description: Free string object to account for any particular methods or lab-specific analysis details.

GasChromatographyAnalysis.title: Gas Chromatography Analysis
GasChromatographyAnalysis.description: Hydrocarbon abundance measured by gas chromatography, e.g. Aromatic,Gasoline,HighTemperature,Pyrolysis,Saturate,SimulatedDistillation,SulfurDetection,ThermalExtraction,WholeOil

items.title: Gas Chromatography Analysis
items.description: Hydrocarbon abundance measured by gas chromatography, e.g. Aromatic,Gasoline,HighTemperature,Pyrolysis,Saturate,SimulatedDistillation,SulfurDetection,ThermalExtraction,WholeOil.

ComponentNameID.title: Component Name ID
ComponentNameID.description: Name of the component in this analysis.  In the case of internal standard compounds, the name of the actual compound should be used in lieu of, e.g. 'STD1', if it is known.

RetentionTime.title: Retention Time
RetentionTime.description: The time it takes for a compound to pass through the GC column and be detected, providing a reference point for comparing other compounds.

Peak.title: Peak
Peak.description: A graphical representation of the highest point (peak) of a detected signal for a compound in the chromatogram graph, a signal which represents to the compound's concentration as a function of time.

AreaValue.title: Area Value
AreaValue.description: Captures the value of the area under the peak.

AreaConcentration.title: Area Concentration
AreaConcentration.description: Concentration of a compound measured using area under the peak for both the compound of interest and the standard compound, along with the known concentration of the standard.

HeightValue.title: Height Value
HeightValue.description: Captures the value of the peak's height.

HeightConcentration.title: Height Concentration
HeightConcentration.description: Concentration of a compound measured using height under the peak for both the compound of interest and the standard compound, along with the known concentration of the standard.

PeakValueTypeUnknown.title: Peak Value Type Unknown
PeakValueTypeUnknown.description: Captures the value of a peak reported without area or height specified.  If the height or area is specified, HeightValue or AreaValue should be used, respectively.

IsInternalStandard.title: Is Internal Standard
IsInternalStandard.description: Identifies whether the component is an internal standard.

InternalStandardCompound.title: Internal Standard Compound
InternalStandardCompound.description: One or more compounds added to a sample in a known quantity before the analysis begins; Also known as an internal standard. Used for accurate identification and quantification.

items.title: Internal Standard Compound
items.description: A compound that is added to a sample in a known quantity before the analysis begins; Also known as an internal standard. Used for accurate identification and quantification.

ComponentNameID.title: Component Name ID
ComponentNameID.description: Name of the component in this analysis.

Mass.title: Mass
Mass.description: The mass of the standard compound.

Concentration.title: Concentration
Concentration.description: The concentration of the standard compound.
